value:
I may be dressed quite down, but
that is all the more reason to conduct
myself in a manner befitting a noble.

Surely there must be at least one or
two nobles in the Order of Heroes,
yes? Hm? Did I say something funny?

Have you seen Lady Rhea? She is an
absolute vision. Even Professor
Byleth is...unexpectedly stunning.

You need not remind me to behave
myself around the ladies. To a noble,
proper etiquette is second nature.

No matter the heat, it would reflect
poorly upon me to complain. It is my
duty to set an example, after all.

I, Lorenz Hellman Gloucester, wish
you a wonderful summer on behalf
of $Nf.

A satisfying result. Did you expect
anything less?

A noble must strive to become
the very picture of strength.
This is...utterly unbecoming.

How sensible of you to appreciate
my excellence.

I am Lorenz Hellman Gloucester.
By the time your summer is over, that
noble name will be unforgettable.

Allow me to thank you for all you've
done this summer. It has been
tremendous, $Nu.$k$pSomeday soon I will need to return to
my responsibilities. The Leicester
Alliance needs me, after all.$k$pWith the future resting upon my
shoulders, I must be ready to lead
on a moment's notice.$k$pBut I do hope that my time here has
been fruitful for you. Surely you have
learned a thing or two, at least?$k$pGo on, then. Summer isn't over yet.
Get out there and show me you know
how to enjoy yourself!
(exertion)
Small fry.
(exertion)
What...
An exalted existence!
Sink beneath me!
You're barely treading water!
Hahaha!
I've got a cramp...
Haha!
A tropical retreat? Lovely. Let it never be said the Order fails to pamper its Heroes.
Hm? Oh, you may set the drinks down just over there. Thank you ever so much.
Worry not, ladies. I am still available.
Do you need protective lotion? I've brought plenty. A noble's skin must be kept pristine, you know.
Even a noble needs a break now and then. A dip in the sea may be just the thing.
To find the analogue of your beauty in nature, I can turn only to the...anemone? Ugh, that's awfulâ€”marine metaphors are not my strong suit.
To lay down the burdens of responsibility, even for a little while, and just enjoy the sun... What a pleasant diversion. Thank you.
Shall we dive in?
We'll swim circles around them.
I always make a splash.
